title: Pakistan
summary: Pakistan, officially the Islamic Republic of Pakistan, is a country in South Asia. It is the world’s sixth-most populous country with a population exceeding 212,742,631 people.

coverImage.altText: Image of Parliament House, Islamabad by Usman Ghani

value.label: Some of the earliest ancient human civilisations in South Asia originated from areas in present-day Pakistan. The Indus region, was the site of several successive ancient cultures including the Neolithic Mehrgarh and the Bronze Age Indus Valley Civilisation at Harappa and Mohenjo-Daro.

The Vedic period was characterised by an Indo-Aryan culture; during this period the Vedas, the oldest scriptures associated with Hinduism, were composed, and this culture later became well established in the region. Successive ancient empires and kingdoms ruled the region, including the Mauryan empire.

Successive ancient empires and kingdoms ruled the region, including the Mauryan empire. The Indo-Greek Kingdom founded by Demetrius of Bactria included Gandhara and Punjab, prospering the Greco-Buddhist culture in the region. Taxila, one of the earliest universities and centres of higher education in the world, which was established during this period.

The Mughals introduced Persian literature and high culture, establishing the roots of Indo-Persian culture in the region. In the early 16th century, the region remained under the Mughal Empire ruled by Muslim emperors. By the early 18th century, increasing European influence contributed to the slow disintegration of the Mughal Empire.

sections.label: Pakistan is an Islamic Republic and has a multi-party parliamentary system. Members of the National Assembly are elected by the citizens. The Prime Minister is the leader of the majority rule party or a coalition in the National Assembly.

image.altText: Image of Mike Pompeo with Imran Khan in Islamabad   2018 (29559549217) (cropped)
Image of President of Pakistan Dr Arif Alvi

value.label: Pakistan is divided into three major geographic areas: the northern highlands, the Indus River plain, and the Balochistan Plateau.
